description: This table stores discrete family history problem information received from outside sources.

columns.name: DOCUMENT_ID
columns.description: This item stores the Received Document record ID.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: FAMILY_PROB_REFID
columns.description: The unique ID of the family member's problem for this row.

columns.name: FAMILY_PROB_ID_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID of the family member's problem for this row. 


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: FAM_MMB_PROB_NAME
columns.description: The display name of the family member's problem for this row.

columns.name: FAM_MMB_PROB_ONSAGE
columns.description: The age of onset for the family member's problem for this row.

columns.name: FAM_PROB_EFF_TIME_DTTM
columns.description: The date and time at which the family member's problem for this row was observed.

columns.name: FAMILY_MEMBER_REFID
columns.description: The unique ID of the family member for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the DOCS_RCVD_FAM_HX_MEM table.

columns.name: FAM_PRB_PERT_NEG_YN
columns.description:
The value that determines whether the problem for this row is a pertinent negative for the family member.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: FAM_MEMPROB_COD_YN
columns.description:
The value that determines whether the problem for this row was a cause of death for the family member.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: FAM_PRB_PERT_NEG_YN

columns.name: FAM_PROB_COMMENTS
columns.description: Comments left for the problem in this row.

columns.name: FAM_PROB_PAT_HX_RESP_C_NAME
columns.description:
The value that indicates the response the patient gave for a given family history problem.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No


No Response


No (Not Pertinent)
